text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT SALES - Egypt's main commodities buyer said Monday he bought 50,000 tonnes of soft red French wheat at $140.50 per tonne for April delivery. On Sunday, Samir Shakankiri, vice chairman of the General Authority for Supply Commodities, bought 450,000 tonnes of French wheat ranging from $140.70 to $143.90.
WHEAT SALES - India bought 125,000 tonnes of Australian wheat at $156 per tonne FOB for March delivery. India was seeking 50,000 tonnes of optional-origin wheat for March.

WHEAT SALE - Syria's General Establishment for Cereal Processing and Trade (GECPT) has sold 10,000 tonnes of hard durum amber wheat at $195.05 to Turkish companies, a spokesman for the GECPT said. He said the wheat, sold on January 22, was part of 50,000 tonnes which was offered for sale on January 17. The amount would be ready for shipment Feb 15-28.

SOYBEAN SALE - South Korea's Shindongbang Corp bought 50,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 soybeans at basis prices over March futures on CBOT. Shipment was set for February from U.S. Gulf. The price was around $289 per tonne FOB, from a U.S. grain exporter.

BARLEY SALE - Five firms bid on Monday at a Turkish Grain Board tender to sell 150,000 tonnes of feed barley and 50,000 tonnes of malting barley for shipment in February and March. They said Cargill, Glencore, Grains & Fourrages plus local companies Rotel and Sesos bid mostly to buy feed barley, while Glencore also sought malting barley at the public tender.
Prices ranged between $121.46 and $133.06 a tonne, depending on shipment dates and ports.
WHEAT TENDER - The CCC said it was seeking up to 40,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 soft white wheat, 13.5 pct moisture, for Pakistan. Shipment period was slated for Feb 20 to March 15.

WHEAT TENDERS - The CCC will tender February 5 for 2,170 tonnes of No.2 hard red winter wheat, ordinary protein, for donation to Uganda. The donation will be made under the World Food Program and will be shipped March 1-25.
- Results are awaited on Bangladesh's tender for 100,000 tonnes U.S. No.2 wheat or Australian or Canadian winter red/spring wheat for shipment by Feb 21, traders said.
- Taiwan will tender for 50,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat on Monday night for last half February and first half March delivery, U.S. exporters said.

WHEAT TENDER - Sri Lanka has opened a tender for 100,000 tonnes of optional origin wheat, for delivery in two lots of hard and soft wheat, an official for the Cooperative Wholesale Establishment said. The tender, for 50,000 tonnes each of hard and soft wheat, will close on February 7.

CORN TENDERS - The CCC said it seeks to buy 27,170 tonnes of No. 2 yellow corn for donation to Uganda, Mozambique and Angola. Offers are due on Feb 5. The CCC said 10,000 tonnes will be donated to Uganda, 9,260 to Mozambique and 7,910 to Angola. Shipment of all three lots was to be March 1-25.

CORN TENDER - Taiwan's Members Feed Industry group said on Monday it would tender on Tuesday for one shipment of 54,000 tonnes of U.S. corn. Shipment would be slated for March 20 to April 4 from the U.S. Gulf or April 5-19 from the PNW.

SORGHUM TENDERS - The CCC would seek 15,000 tonnes of U.S. no. 2 or better sorghum, of which 5,000 tonnes would be for donation to Uganda and 10,000 tonnes for Ethiopia. The shipment period was March 1-25 and offers due on Feb 5.

RICE TENDERS - Colombia is preparing to tender for up to 50,000 tonnes of rice to help cover a shortfall in domestic production, Agriculture Ministry sources said. They said a formal announcement regarding the tender was expected to be made by Agriculture Minister Cecilia Lopez sometime next week.

- U.S. rice traders and exporters confirmed Iraq tendered on Monday for 30,000 tonnes of U.S. long grain white milled rice, broken 10 percent maximum, under the nation's "food-for-oil" program with the United Nations. Offers are to be opened through Feb 5. The tender was divided into two 15,000-tonne positions, with one for April delivery and for May.

RICE TENDERS - Syria's General Foreign Trade Organisation for Chemicals and Foostuffs has issued an international tender to buy 12,000 tonnes of white rice for shipment in April. March 3 was set as the final date to receive bids and confirmation would be made on March 12. Syria is already in the market for a 12,000 tonne consignment of rice under a tender issued on January 6. That tender was set February 3 as the final date for bids, with results due on February 13.
